website_summaries.verdict: If you like the idea of the pleasant scent, these tough waste bags are worth a look. However, they may be a bit shorter than expected.
pros: Stand out for their scent and added baking soda that helps control odor
Sturdy bags in three colors – blue, gray, black – that do a good job concealing waste
Bags will fit in most standard dispensers
cons: No bag measurements noted, but a few users find them shorter than some competing bags

customer_reviews.title: Major quality drop
customer_reviews.text: Used to love these, but they just dropped the quality on them dramatically! That are still nice & large, but they are so thin it is ridiculous. They are almost translucent now. No longer nice and durable. Done buying these after a year of loyalty. Photo before is dark blue now is light blue.
customer_reviews.author: LT in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Use if you want a surprise on your hands
customer_reviews.text: Some bags are not sealed properly. Discovered this the hard way after trying to pick up some poo. Had to walk all the way home with freezing hands since it was filthy! Do not recommend these. Also they are thin and very transparent.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Works with munchkin diaper bag dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Came across these when looking for refills for my sons diaper baggies and figured I'd give them a try since they are a much better value than the ones made for babies. Only difference is these are somewhat unscented and the baby ones have a floral fragrance to them. They still do a great job of trapping the smell though and are the same exact size to fit in the munchkin diaper bag dispenser!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little bags. I use them in my cars waste basket.
customer_reviews.author: Treceg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for a 180-count of bags
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for a 180-count of bags, easily beats Target and other retailers. But a note: I thought these were the same size as theI'd been using. They are not, these are significantly bigger: 14 inches tall by about 8 inches wide vs. 10 inches by 7 inches for the 71092 ones. Doesn't matter much to me as I don't use them in a dispenser, but if you do that might make these a pain to reload. Also, the "fresh scent" these have doesn't really do anything against the kitty litter droppings, but I didn't really expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tsiokos

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THESE BAGS
customer_reviews.text: First, they don't tear off the roll easily. It takes much time and effort to find the perforations and half the time they aren't perfed all the way through. I've had to unroll the rolls and scissor the bags apart, then stuff them in my pockets which defeats the whole notion of bags on a roll in a container attached to the leash. Secondly, for the third time, I picked up poop and am blocks away when I notice I am carrying an empty bag. No idea where it dropped out, I'm hoping nobody stepped in it. There was a slit in the middle of the bag from which the poop left. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD SHERWIN

customer_reviews.title: Suggested as Add-on but not as BIG
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Petmate 71034 Arm & Hammer Swivel Bin & Rake Pooper Scooper and it came with two bags that were fabulous in size and strength. As suggested for add-on I purchased this box of 75 count. The bags in this box are much smaller than the ones that came with the Bin/Rake. I cannot find a link to see what bags I need to purchase instead. Can anyone help?
customer_reviews.author: Leesa Wachsman

customer_reviews.title: No compostable!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are much more expensive than the regular Arm & Hammer waste bags but I was willing to pay more because they were compostable. However, the bags I received were not compostable. They had a different label than what is pictured on the description. No where on it does it say compostable. I figured I already had them so might as well use them but they don’t fit in the Arm & Hammer dispenser, are a shorter shape and really thin. I don’t use these to pick up dog poop but I can’t imagine how awful these would be for that. A few have ripped easily.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering artificial scent
customer_reviews.text: I admit it. I was duped by the odor control with baking soda. Once. But I won't buy these again. The scent is so overwhelming that I wouldn't let my cat, who likes to unroll the bags and bat the plastic center piece around our living room, near the bags. I threw them away. Does Arm & Hammer really think this horrible perfume is going to make the smell inside the bags go away? It doesn't. You end up with dueling unpleasant scents.
customer_reviews.author: Nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Important features!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, poop bag connoisseur / bargain hunter here, with simple but important poop bag requirements: bag must be sturdy bag must be easy to open bag must keep the smell inside These Arm and Hammer bags check all the boxes. Ive purchased over 5 packs and haven’t had a single failure or split seam. And each bag has a white stripe on the bottom, so you always know where to start separating. And the fresh sent helps keep the smell down... These also happen to be some of the most cost effective bags out there ($/bag). So yeah, I’ll keep buying these bags to pick up the poop from my Doggo and Floofer.
customer_reviews.author: Betty the Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I had hit the jackpot when I saw these because they are priced several dollars cheaper and you get a lot more than the bags that are specifically for diapers. Little did I know that immediately they rip. About 8 out of 10 bags that I have you so far rips right open as I am tying it up. They are poorly made and not worth the money. Will not be buying these again. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ELC

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit the Flexi leash bag dispensers
customer_reviews.text: I will use the bags but I am disappointed that they do not fit my dispenser. I have the Flexi leash bag dispenser that lets the bags roll as you use then and the plastic roll the bags are wrapped around is too small to fit my dispenser. I used the Amazon basic bags all last year but thought I'd give these a try. I will be going back to the Amazon basic bags
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good for apartment
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment with my kitty, and her litterbox gets cleaned far more frequently than I empty the kitchen trash. This means that within a day or two my garbage smells worse than the litterbox! I started out with used grocery plastic bags, but those are cheap (eg they have holes in them), and I prefer to shop with reusable bags anyhow. So this was my solution! I like that these bags are biodegradable so I don't have to ask for plastic grocery bags anymore for cat scooping! The smell seems far more manageable in my kitchen trash after i tie the bag in a little knot, and kitty still gets her litterbox cleaned daily! Everyone wins!
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Trboyevich

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have loved the product for a very long time. But within the past several months have been terribly disappointed with the issues of these bags tearing apart easily. This is a big issues when you are trying to manipulated your dog's leash while attempting to retrieve her "deposits". I now have to struggle repeatedly to tear off a bag, even though there are (or are supposed to be) perforated lines to make this task easy. This is a problem of sloppy product control. This is an embarrassment for such an otherwise well known product. Love the product but will stop using. Life is too short to aggravate over this.
customer_reviews.author: Sassygirl

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The bags are sturdy enough for the use. We use them all over the house. Bathroom needs. Kitchen (like ancient leftovers going to the trash). Patio (cleaning ashtrays)... And so. The main reason I bought them and I am really happy I am doing it is to discard all the disposable materials used to take care of my patient (my sister with Alzheimer). Having them, make easy her cleaning and bathing every day. They hold her used underwear and the bedding sheets we use. I don’t have to worry about any odor these things may have. The bags hold them in place. Inside! Very good option the A&H 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: yoly

customer_reviews.title: Best dog bags I've found so far for the value
customer_reviews.text: These are great bags. I keep some with me at all times, and they have lasted quite a while. I've never had any issues with them tearing, and they are long enough to be able to easily tie them in a knot when done. I usually use 2 at a time, one to put waste in, and one turned inside-out to use as a glove. When I run out I will purchase these again. They also fit great in any waste bag holder I have.
customer_reviews.author: TheOddCollector

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These bags are ok, but the rolls are too thick for my little roll dispenser, which I’ve never had a problem with in two years of using it. Also, these bags are hard to tear after pulling out. Instead of a deep perforation that allows you to tear while the bag is folded, you have to unroll the bag strip far enough that you can unfold the bag before tearing, or you won’t be able to. It’s a real pain when you’re walking two energetic dogs, like I regularly do. I end up unrolling a couple bags before leaving and sticking them in my pocket. Not the convenience I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: OrlRubies

customer_reviews.title: Cover the stink, feel secure they won’t leak or break
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it, the worst thing about having a dog is that you have to pick up their poop. Well with these bags it makes it a bit better. They have a light scent that decently covers the poo poo smell. And the major bonus: • I feel safe that the bag will hold it’s contents and there is no worry of ripping or leakage or even stinky vapor waves escaping I hope they aren’t the worst for the environment but it’s possible. I also leave a roll on my cat’s litter box to throw her refuse in and cover its scent even when it stays in the trash can for a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Artist

customer_reviews.title: Good Cat Litter Bags
customer_reviews.text: I think these are designed for dog poo, but we use them for scooping cat litter. One bag easily holds a day's worth of 2 cats using a litter box. The scoop fits inside the bag with room to spare. The plastic in the bag isn't very thick but it's sturdy enough to hold cat litter without ripping. We've never had one rip. And with 75 bags in the box, we only have to buy them a few times a year. Beats keeping plastic shopping bags around.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: flimsy, very difficult to tear off ....DONT BUY ,!
customer_reviews.text: ok ...I usually read the reviews before I buy but I guess I saw the 41/2 stars and 3,435 reviews so got lazy ...the description says easy tear ..WELL THEY ARE NOT EASY TEAR and I have had to throw two or three out because of this . secondly they are so flimsy that Inimmediately have to discard after one time by that I mean Inusually use one per walk . now I use two maybe three each walk.I thought the brand name Arm &Hammercwould make a quality product NOT.so I will be ordering different bags .Shame on me for not reading the reviews .
customer_reviews.author: Kay b

customer_reviews.title: You might want to double bag it
customer_reviews.text: This are alright. I have been using them to scoop my cats litter into. They dont cancel the smell completely so I was a bit disappointed. I have recenly started double bagging them and that has seemed to work better.
customer_reviews.author: whit123free

customer_reviews.title: Too thin
customer_reviews.text: These bags aren't awful, but they're not great, either. Too thin, too stretchy (making it hard to tear off a new bag), and just a tiny bit too short -- making it easy to get poop on your fingers in an attempt to knot it closed. Tearing off the stickers holding each roll closed tends to tear the first bag on the roll, rendering it useless. And the dang things are translucent, so you can enjoy the sight of feces all the way to the waste bin... I much preferred the heavier, darker bags available from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: FA in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kitty Litter
customer_reviews.text: Great little litter baggies for my cat. Before getting my cat from the shelter, I was researching litter disposal systems and decided that scooping my sifting litter box twice a day and disposing of the litter in these baggies, is the best option for me. Our trash (lidded) has zero odors coming out of it between trash collection days, so these bags are working as intended by keeping odors sealed in. I use pine litter that already masks litter odor really well, and the combination is definitely one that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Why use the bag when they always tear!  At that rate, just use your hand.
customer_reviews.text: Can they make these bags out of any thinner, weaker material? Constant issues with tears in the bags when trying to pick up a mess. No matter how gentle you try to be, if you're picking one up on concrete, know you're gonna be wearing just a little bit on your fingers. Try to gently tie one with a little of Fido's mess in the knot - that stuff will blorp out under the slightest pressure making sure it's worked into your knuckle like a #2 lotion. Do not buy this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Smakky

customer_reviews.title: Strong bags; difficult to separate
customer_reviews.text: The bags are fine in use. I have not encountered any tears or other weakness. But the bags do not easily separate from the roll. In other brands I am able to tug the bag free without knowing exactly where the perforation is located. Not so with these: I have to locate the perforation and carefully tear the bag loose. Doesn't seem like a big deal ... until you have to do it pre-dawn on a freezing morning. :) My next bag purchase will try a different brand of dog bags.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hill

customer_reviews.title: Quality Has Gone Way Down Hill - Will No Longer Order These
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this product for many, many years and have always been very satisfied. However, the last two orders that I placed, I've noticed that the bags tear very easily just trying to open them. This product has cheapened so much in quality and is no longer the same. I am sorry to say, that I will no longer order from them due to this...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Scooping bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to clean my cat's litter box and they work as expected. The plastic is on the thin side and will stretch or tear on occasion if it hits the scoop wrong or gets too heavy. I also wish the scent was a bit stronger as a bag may sit in my trash for a day or so before it all goes to the trash room.
customer_reviews.author: Raembee

customer_reviews.title: Smell HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: These smell so toxic it’s ridiculous. Even though the discription DOES NOT say they are scented (yes I see in the pictures of ONE it says fresh scent) but as stated in discritpion the packaging my vary depending on what you order. DO NOT buy these bags. I open the bag and took them straight outside as the smell so so strong it filled the whole house. Absolutely disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Hatten

customer_reviews.title: yuk!  threw away!
customer_reviews.text: These smell horrible and even after washing my hands, the scent lingered...way overpowering! Hard to tear off from roll. Does NOT fit standard dispensers...well, you can squeeze it in but then you can't tear off any bags! I threw these away and went back to my black Amazon Basics...they work great! I was just trying to save money by buying these...what a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I didn't purchase the dispenser because the reviews led me to believe it isn't necessary nor will it last long but I purchased these bags for my cat's litter and I must say they are small but they hold alot and the mask any smell amazingly - even if tossed into a larger trashcan before it's taken out later in the day. I was previously just re-using plastic grocery bags but that didn't mask any smell so I'm thankful I discovered and purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Amin

customer_reviews.title: Really good dog poop bags
customer_reviews.text: These are really sturdy and nice sized bags. It's nice that they have a nice scent to them and honestly it does cut down on the other scent. I really like how thick these are, I've yet to have one break. In fact I can untie one if my girl needs to go some more further down the way. My only complaint, and its a small one is that the bags can be a little difficult to tear. That said this is the bag I'll buy over and above any else.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Danzeisen

customer_reviews.text: Works great 60% of the time. 60% of the time, these are the best bags you could possibly buy. They are sturdy, and smell great. 40% of the time, the bags will not tear off of the roll. The strength of Hulk could not get these bags to tear. You will stand by your dog beside his steaming s**t while your neighbors shame you trying to tear these bags from the roll. You will eventually abandon the poop and never make eye contact with your neighbors again. But 60% of the time they do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Diminishes/Captures Scent-No Overpowering Perfume
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted two cats, and these bags came with their litter box and other belongings. I've never used these little baggies, but I'm in love with them! They are NOT perfumed, but seem to capture and diminish the smell from clumping litter pee balls and poops. I ordered extra to give to my friends who have cats.
customer_reviews.author: Flyakite13

customer_reviews.title: Stink Control Success!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are amazing at containing the smell of dirty diapers. As a child care teacher of toddlers I have changed my fair share of horribly smelling diapers, even the diaper pail was not enough to control the stink. I had decided to give these a try in hopes that upon entering my classroom one wouldn’t be hit by the poop smell. The results were terrific, goal achieved! While the bags are very good at smell control I do find them to be very thin.
customer_reviews.author: teachergirl

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent product through Amazon. I ordered these bags in May to help with managing my cat litter waste and LOVED them. Went to reorder, had to spend a few bucks more and purchase through a different seller. The product box I received looked the same, but the bags are VERY STRONGLY scented. To the point that they make me sick. I will be throwing these away, unfortunately. The last box was great with odor control WITHOUT A SCENT... Very frustrated that I didn't receive the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: These are TINY.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: they do block odor pretty effectively, even from a 9-cat household. Cons: Bags are TINY. Barely room to get your hand in there; litter scoop definitely doesn't fit. Lots of spills. If you're using these to clean up after dogs (which is probably their intended use), they're probably fine for that, assuming you don't have a very large dog.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Ordering Again - That has to say they are good
customer_reviews.text: I'm back to ordering these bags again. I didn't realize that I hadn't left a review for them yet, so here I am. These are easy to have next to the kitty litter to clean out the tray as well as carrying around on dog walks. They are thick enough to feel safe using your hand and flipping inside out no problem. Even the kids will use these, and that's saying something. There are so many in the package, it's definitely worth the price !
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Love these bags.
customer_reviews.text: These bags are incredible and I'm upset I never knew about them before. I have 2 cats and I use them to dispose of their litter in. Using regular bags before was attracting too many flies to our trashcans in our new home. So I switched to these and no problems since. The bags smell wonderful and truly block out the unpleasant pet waste odor once you close them up. Great purchase and I will continue buying.
customer_reviews.author: JokerNHarley

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal bags!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had thought of these years ago!! They are just perfect for scooping my litter box every day. I have 5 cats and it holds all their business and cuts way down on the odor. I live in an apt and the dumpster is pretty far away, so we don't take it out for a few days and I don't even smell it. These are so very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Works great, scent is kind of different
customer_reviews.text: One in 50 or so has a hole in it. That said, they are a bit thicker than some others I've had which is nice for thorough cleanup if dog goes in street or other unpredictable places (why Harley?? Why?) Handy to pick up random things: poison ivy, cat box contents, someone's used tissues. I keep them in the car too. Really handy. The scent is a unnecessary waste, but kind of arm n hammers thing, so not going to get away from it. Basically so far all the doodoo bags have been about the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: The Laura Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite poop bags
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried ordering these because a prior reviewer said the bags have changed and are not as good. I can’t see any change. I have had trouble with other brands either being not sealed on 3 sides, being smaller, or being so strongly scented my closet stank. This bags have a scent if I put my nose on them but I don’t notice otherwise. They are a good size and sturdy and serve their duty well.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the arm and hammer bags made for diapers, but they were getting pretty expensive. I love that those bags are heavily scented, but it was a waste for pee diapers. I decided to buy these dog poop bags for the pee diapers, and I am saving so much money! I save the better diaper bags for poop diapers and use these for pee diapers. I don't know why I didn't think of this sooner! They don't block the oders as well and they are slightly smaller, so I wouldn't recommend them for poop diapers. Overall, these were a fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Bags are unreliable for collecting dog waste
customer_reviews.text: These bags are specifically for dog walking/waste collecting. A&H is a wonderful company; I use various A&H products regularly. These bags are very thin (which is not huge issue for me), but recently I find that as I collect my dog’s waste I have two open ends...I know that tear them properly. It isn’t every roll but way too often lately. The product is inexpensive and perhaps I got what I paid for....still, very disappointed and will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Shula Holtz

customer_reviews.title: Is it possible to have a favorite poop bag?
customer_reviews.text: My fellow dog owners, these are THE poop bags. Before using, i would have scoffed at a scented bag - like whats the point?! But now I will never use another bag. These are sturdy (a bit thicker than most bags) and the smell really makes a big difference for such a stinky task. I pick up lots of poop in our yard and end up throwing the bags into outside trash bin. Using these bags has SIGNIFICANTLY helped the smell of that trash can. Highly recommend to everyone! (Also great for storing dirty diapers or dirty toddler clothes when you're on the run and there's not a trash can available.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: First, the good: You can use these as hand bags, you know, put your hand in the bag and grab the poopie.dookie. You also use them as a repository, and SCOOP up the poopie.dookie. Now, let's talk about the bad: not real durable. They'll break on you and then you have dookie disaster. They smell all right, but man, my cat's dook overpowers the scent of these bags in no time. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: the king of pencils and sharpeners

customer_reviews.title: Might not fit your waste bag holder
customer_reviews.text: The bags are fine. They are lightly scented, but not as strong as some other brands. I only dock a star because the roll that the bags are wrapped around are hexagonal rather than round so they didn’t fit my dog bag holder (see photo). Not sure why they had to go creative with this. I had another holder that I could squeeze the roll into but it’s harder to pull out a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Why did they change these?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying and subscribing These bags for some time now. Good quality, scent, value. Most recent shipment came, these bags are now much more translucent than before. They’re essentially clear. Why?? Given the choice, I really wouldn’t choose to carry a dog turd in a clear bag on a hot summer day. The only thing I can control in this situation is... the bag I use. Maybe I got a knock-off?
customer_reviews.author: Does it come in Orange?

customer_reviews.title: The best doggie bags..
customer_reviews.text: When you tie the end into a knot, there's no smell which makes for easy disposal. The bags themselves have a very pleasant smell to them. A tip: They were a bit difficult to open the open end until I figured out to just wet your fingers a little but, then just slide them over the end and they open right up. I've used this brand for several years now and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Not great for sealing in cat litter odors
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these from another brand because the price was right. But I noticed that our mud room with the cat box was starting to smell. We have two small cats so I typically use one bag for a few scoops throughout a day, twisting it shut after each use. The bags don't seal in odors. I imagine they're fine for single use but I'll be switching back to the pricier brand.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: These bags are wonderful for children’s dirty diapers
customer_reviews.text: These bags are wonderful for children’s dirty diapers! I use them when traveling away from home and don’t have to worry about stinking up someone else’s home. Never any torn bags, well made, and great price currently. These are also great to use as a ‘pre-wrap’ to the really bad dirty diapers at home before putting into your diaper disposal system... helps keep the stink at bay so you don’t have to change the system bags as often.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It 'was' pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use these for kitty wastes and it gets the job done. I don't know if the odor control works or not, but I don't smell anything. I do get the occasional ripped bag, but that's like 2 out of 180. No big deal. These are now my go to bags for kitty wastes. Edit - Unfortunately, I have phased these bags out of usage. The price increase in this item put it in range of other bags that I felt gave a better bang for your buck or higher bag count. I do like these bags, but I have since moved on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: May not work with your bag dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy Arm & Hammer's 180 count biodegradable waste bags (71092), but thought I might save a few bucks this time. What I learned is that the ends of the center spindle for these bag rolls is a hexagon while the spindle of the biodegradable bags is round (see pictures). These bags would not work with my bag dispenser until I drilled them out.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I, also, use these liners to put dish drainer scrap food in. Instead of stinking up your trash, I keep a plastic 1 lb coffee container (with lid) by my sink. After washing dishes and draining water, I put the scraps of food from drainer in the lined coffee container. When I take the trash out, then this liner is tied up and thrown out also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay but doesn't tear as easily as should
customer_reviews.text: Work fine but are a little thin and the bags don't tear as easily as they should.. not really a problem except when it's dark outside as it's a pain to try to find the tear lines. The scent is decent but it seems to be on the inside of the bag, so not sure it's that effective when you turn inside out to pick up the dog poop.
customer_reviews.author: rdy2run

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I use these to discard scooped cat litter and dispose. Each time I pull a piece apart from the roll, I get a whiff of the pleasant smell. These really do help with odor control and the fragrance is great. The size is good and I could actually use a smaller size with same width. They are sturdy and no issues with leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Tiarfe

customer_reviews.title: A little too transparent
customer_reviews.text: These bags have a nice smell with the baking soda/scent pre-applied. The main issue is the bags are slightly thin, so you can see through them. It just isn't the most pleasant experience to see it through the bag when you're carrying it. Bags separate easily and have a nice smell though, so they're OK overall.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great for the price. I have two MINOR criticisms. First, they are slightly more transparent than other brands, so you are stuck looking at the contents until you get to a garbage can. Second, it is slightly hard to tear a bag off at the perforation. Again, both minor inconveniences I can live with. I just ordered more today.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Alan Greene

customer_reviews.title: Best poop pick up bag...period!
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal for poop pick-up! Easy tie closure and creates small loop for easy carry until able to properly dispose. Activated baking powder for odor neutralizing actually helps to mask the PU odor! My local store seems to always be sold out and the price is higher. This is the way to go. Saves me time, gas, money and is delivered to my front door!
customer_reviews.author: 64jjdragon

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: First time ordering these and they are nice and large for my 65lb lab’s big piles of 💩. The smell of the scented bag is pleasant and really does cut down on oder when I’m stuck holding it on a walk. Minus one star because the bags are kind of annoying to tear off. They don’t tear easily. I’d still buy them again though!
customer_reviews.author: Kdawg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1-cat households
customer_reviews.text: Nice Dove soap like scent - not flowery and is the perfect size if you only have one cat and clean their box every day, have an apartment without a garbage room, or for dog walking. I do not recommend for multicat or nondaily litterbox cleaning households. A large scooper fits in fine unlike what other reviews say, but you can really only fit three “gifts” your cat left you.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Can't  tear off a bag without opening it up
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be perforated enough to facilitate tearing a bag off to use. I was wrong. It's a battle for me, a retired woman who manages a household. I may not be representative of other people because I have arthritis in my hands and wrists. However, I am a baby boomer and we are a HUGE cohort. So, fellow boomers, I do not recommend these. Fortunately I did not buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Retired RN

customer_reviews.title: Don’t fit, Easy break & horrible scent
customer_reviews.text: These bags do not fit the doggie bag holder spindles. These bags tear pretty easy so be careful picking up after your dog. Also, the scent these bags have is similar to Febreeze which very strong and pungent. Let’s just not hope that the chemicals they use for the scent aren’t the same as Febreeze. Febreeze like many odor removers is a neurotoxin. Manufacturers should stick to activated charcoal for odors. It is a much less toxic and better way to control odors.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D

customer_reviews.title: Using for baby diapers instead of dog
customer_reviews.text: These are great at hiding gross smells, and super portable and durable. I use them to refill our "Munchkin Arm and Hammer Diaper Bag Dispenser" & they work just as well with dirty diapers as I'm sure they do with dog poo, but cost much less than the ones marketed for diaper bags. The colors aren't as bright & cheerful....but who cares?
customer_reviews.author: StarDust

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these if you use bags from a dispenser!
customer_reviews.text: How cheap... they made the little spindle (that the bags are wrapped on) too small to fit a standard dispenser. I'm just outside of the return window, so I'm screwed. I tried them in two different kinds of dispensers with the same result. It seems the spindles are SUPPOSED to be standard, but these are way TOO SMALL.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas SteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great bags for poop.
customer_reviews.text: Was using the dollar store bags and tired of my hand busting through them. I thought I'd try these and I'm not disappointed. I won't go back to any other bag. I know it sounds funny but these work great. They're strong , fairly large and it is kind of cool having them scented. I recommend them
customer_reviews.author: jonsride

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I found these bags difficult to tear off from the roll, difficult to separate from one another and without a clear marking for where the opening is. I will not buy these again. On the plus side, they are a very nice color and have a pleasant scent. They are also an adequate size and strength to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: You know, it's hard to be positive about something that you are literally picking up crap with, but these bags had a nice little clean scent with them and they have handles that makes the bag easy to tie. I've been using these bags for over a year now and never once has one torn on me, even after I accidentally leave one in my pocket and it goes through the laundry. it's still a good bag that you can use. 10/10 would recommend to anyone picking up shiz.
customer_reviews.author: Bridger H

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to tear off
customer_reviews.text: I buy many arm and Hammer products so I decided to try these bags. They are sturdy and smell nice but almost impossible to pull off the roll. It makes taking my dogs out very frustrating, especially while wearing gloves. I have been a dog owner all my life and used many different bags. I have put these away as back up and re-ordered my regular bags. I do not recommend these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great bags, smell a little funny
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying bags from a $1 store and they are always thing and break, not what you want to happen dealing with poo. I decided to try these. They are nice and thick. The bags are pretty large so they would be good for any size animal. The only thing I don’t like is the smell. I think it is supposed to be like a powder smell, but it is honestly a little offensive to my nose and then my hands smell like it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: You will go through them!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is in love with these. He likes the pleasant scent and the fact that he can get his hand a good way in there (no chance of touching doggie poo!) when he's taking the dog out. We are using them up faster than we expected. Great product and we will continue to re-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KC42

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend these bags!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these bags!!! At first, my daughter was using Walmart/Kroger type bags and we would always smell the nasties all the way down the hall even inside the bags!! After buying these bags, I no longer smell cat poop. My daughter even re-uses them until they're too full to tie off, then she gets a new one. 100% recommend these bags!
customer_reviews.author: KrystleN02

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and consistent
customer_reviews.text: We use these to dispose of sanitary items that we don’t flush and diapers. The quality is always consistent and we have never had a bad batch so far. We have been buying these regularly for several years and I highly recommend them for whatever your disposal needs are. I sometimes use them when disposing of runny leftovers so they don’t soil the can. Versatile is a word that comes to mind when describing these!
customer_reviews.author: fdt

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, just a tad thin
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheaper alternative to the Arm & Hammer Munchkin bags. These bags are a good choice. They fit in the bag holder that comes with the munchkin bags just find. I find, however, that these bags are a bit thinner and shorter. If your kid makes a really big stinker, you may have to double up, but for the price, the switch was worth it. I would think the same could be said about their ability to hold your dog's business. Also - and this information doesn't impact my future re-purchase - I find these bags have an odd odor that I don't love. It's manageable, however.
customer_reviews.author: Maerlyn8

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Smells DISGUSTING. OMG, I would rather smell poop than these bags. 2)Stickers make it hard to start a roll without ripping the first bag, Would prefer rubber bands than stickers. 3)Bags are too long. 4)There are a lot and it's good for the price. Would not repurchase though.
customer_reviews.author: No one

customer_reviews.title: ok bags for very short term use
customer_reviews.text: These are ok if you're using them to pick up and dispose of immediately. If you're holding till trash pick up day, these won't fly... they're very thin and the smells go right through...
customer_reviews.author: Jo Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for Raccoon Poop
customer_reviews.text: I invert the bag to use it to pick up raccoon poop in my yard, and then turn it back right side out and tie a knot. This gives me a good way to dispose of racoon poop. The raccoons where I live have larger poop than dog poop, so these bags help me take care of a nasty situation.
customer_reviews.author: TurboShopper

customer_reviews.title: Waste of too much plastic
customer_reviews.text: These litter bags are quite large --perhaps ideal if you have to pick up after a St Bernard, but I feel like they are twice the size needed for a small dog poop. In the days of being mindful of wasting plastic, I am bothered each time I pick up a small poop in a bag big enough to put a baby diaper. ALSO --the perforations are very difficult to see and tear off each bag. NOT my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: travelgal

customer_reviews.title: Awful Bags!!!  Rip before getting them off the roll!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are very cheaply made and rip easily. I have lost several bags that ripped when I was tearing them off the roll at the perforation! I expected a stronger scent to the bags to contain odors. These barely had a smell. Would NOT RECOMMEND these!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Tinted Ziploc
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with these bags at all, but they are almost completely transparent - you can see a little too much of everything inside them. Haven't had any issues with the bags breaking and they hold up great, but they are reallllly thin and a little more see through than I wish they were in public. It is like holding dog poop in a tinted ziploc baggie. Wish they were no so see through but they do their job so they get 4 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Won't refill other manufacturer's doggie bag dispensers!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal but plan on buying a dispenser as the spool this is wrapped around don't fit any of my current dispensers. They are nice for the job and open as easily as any plastic bag does. (Important for the task at hand!) I like that there are lines to indicate where the tear and opening areas are on the roll. Thanks to the purchaser who mentioned the diaper bag dispenser! The dog bag dispensers don't have great reviews and I really prefer to have a dispenser for the walks.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to find perforation
customer_reviews.text: It's almost impossible to find the perforations to be able to tear the bags off. Then, once you're able to get the bag off, no easy task by the way, finding the top and trying to open them is even harder. And all this while your dog is pulling on the leash. Bad choice! Oh, and I don't smell any scent on them at all.
customer_reviews.author: jilliangran

customer_reviews.title: They don't all work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these (even put them on subscription) but I will l not get them again. There are 3 colors, blue, silver and grey..the grey tear apart the minute you touch them. So if you are out walking your dog and you reach for the grey bag you will be holding "dogging droppings" in your bare hands. I will never order them again. They weren't the cheapest but they were not helpful...
customer_reviews.author: jennismom

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy a different brand (from Walmart) but thought I'd try these as I like other Arm & Hammer products. The perforated edge is not fully perforated and results in torn bags. Additionally the sealed edge on some bags has opened when I put my hand in the bag - not good! The scent is pleasant, but not the main reason I buy poop bags!
customer_reviews.author: Sonjia

customer_reviews.title: ease-of-use durability no sitting there fussing trying to open the bag
customer_reviews.text: I love that these open easily I never thought I'd be reviewing dog poop bags but they are big so if you have a big dog or multiple dogs it's nice to have to fuss less great bags
customer_reviews.author: Kristine black

customer_reviews.title: Good for baby diapers too
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my son's poopy diapers and they really block the smell. Much cheaper than other products on the market and they fit in the munchkin diaper bag dispenser perfectly. They are a little smaller then the ones made for diapers/babies but they still function just as well! The scent isn't overwhelming either.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: best value, nice scent
customer_reviews.text: You will need to tear each bag off the remaining roll. Considering what a good value this product is, it is well worth the effort to tear off each bag. Perhaps Armond Hammer could improve this "tearing" procedure by clearly indicating where to tear and increasing the perforations along the "tear" line.
customer_reviews.author: John San

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bags, corn starch based
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews said they received the wrong kind of bags. I got the ones intended, they are a tad more expensive but I feel the value is in knowing they can biodegrade faster. I don't use holders or anything and just keep a roll in my pocket on walks. The bags are a bit thinner than regular dog poop bags. Amazon had them cheaper than target, where I normally got them.
customer_reviews.author: McGnarman

customer_reviews.title: Hard to separate....then rip down the middle.
customer_reviews.text: Darn it, I really wanted to like these. They're hard to tear/separate from the next bag and 9/10 times they will tear down the middle and you're unable to use them. It's bummer because they smell much better than other bags, a decent size and you get a lot of bags for your money. I ended up just tossing them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good for baby diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use these for baby diapers. They seem to fit the arm and hammer holders for doggie or diaper bags and help reduce the smell. They are smaller than the diaper bags made for babies specifically. These probably aren't useful for large dogs but for a diaper they work pretty well
customer_reviews.author: MariaJ

customer_reviews.title: Thin. Flimsy. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These bags are so thin and flimsy i have to double up to be sure I wont make a mess cleaning my pet's mess. I will not buy again and I suggest you look elsewhere. The bag i was previously using went out of stock. I picked these thinking there wouldnt be any variation in pet waste bags. I was wrong. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Arwen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open but thin gauge plastic
customer_reviews.text: I normally purchase the blue/lt gray/dk gray Arm & Hammer Disposable Pet Waste Bags. These were much shorter (harder to pick up poop w/o getting messy), and much thinner gauge plastic. The only positive, is that they are much easier to open than the traditional rolled bags (don't stick together at the opening).
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I use this product anyway (and like it) but found it to be less expensive online. The only drawback is the fact that it is an add-on product when buying, so I have to wait till I am buying something else to order. But the bags themselves are durable- no handle ties if you are not familiar with these bags, but I prefer NO handle ties so that all works out. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Huff

customer_reviews.title: Strong and tear resistant
customer_reviews.text: I use these for disposing of feline presents from the the litter box. They are quite strong and have not had one tear yet, even with using a litter scoop. The bags are a little small - I find them to be adequate but my better half has mentioned preferring a larger bag when the kitties are feeling overly generous. Perfect size for using inverted on ones hand to pick [stuff] up though.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for the swivel bin
customer_reviews.text: Very misleading on Amazon. When purchasing the swivel bin, these show up as an item to buy. They DO NOT fit the swivel bin, thus they were a complete waste of my money. Otherwise, slightly larger than other pooh bags, but way more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: cope's stuff

customer_reviews.title: next to impossible to insert into standard waste bag holder
customer_reviews.text: Once I finally get the roll of bags inserted in the plastic "bone" waste bag holder that I keep on our dog's leash, the fit is so tight that the bag roll won't rotate. So I have to manually open the "bone" and unroll a bag each time I need one. I have had this particular waste bag holder for years, and have never before encountered such a problem. I will never purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa Berall

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: Good odor-blocking bags for litter-box clean-up. Unfortunately, they have the same issue as the no-handle Arm & Hammer waste bags: they're just plain too small. I can at least get the litter scoop into these (unlike the others) but the extra room you get from the wider opening & handles is offset by the shallowness of the bag. If you have to scoop multiple boxes, plan on using a separate bag for each box.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: These doggy poop bags are not easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: The perforaton to rip it off from the roll id not perforated fully, and I have to strugfgle to find it and rip it off the roll. That was the very reason I purchaed new bags, and I am very disappointed Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carole from Florida

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pet waste
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when we ran out of the bags we were using to collect our dog’s waste, and I’m not going back! These bags mask the odor so that my trash can doesn’t smell when they sit in there all week before the trash is collected. They are also sturdy and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: kay00dee

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to seperate bags at perforation
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about doggie bags? Nice size and weight, but very difficult to tear bags apart on the perforated line. Easier to cut apart with scissors along perforation. I now have a basket full, but don't think I will reorder again, due to this issue
customer_reviews.author: Katie burris

customer_reviews.title: A one time purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: The perforation line is difficult to see ( Even in full daylight!!!) After dark - 'tis a freaking joke! And it's also difficult to tear the bags off the roll!!! The perforation needs to be better - and MUCH easier to see! The bag holder makes it even more difficult because it binds the roll, making things even more difficult! Will NEVER purchase again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

product_meta.title: Petmate Arm & Hammer Disposable Pet Waste Bags
product_meta.description: Size:180-pack| Style:AssortedWith Arm & Hammer's Disposable Waste Bags Refills, pet parents can bring Arm & Hammer's odor-control fresh scent technology wherever they go. The compact roll of pet waste bags is conveniently portable for pets and pet parents on the move, and include perforated, easy-tear seams for quick bag retrieval. These dog bags for poop are equipped with Arm & Hammer's odor-control fresh scent technology, featuring activated baking soda to eliminate odors on the spot for more pleasant pick-ups. Twice as thick as standard grocery bags, these durable doggie bags for poop hold up to heavy-duty use. To keep Arm & Hammer's odor-control fresh scent technology close at hand, these waste bag rolls fit within most standard sized pet bag dispensers that require bags to unroll from the outside and are available in 90-count and 180-count multi-packs. These multi-purpose small garbage bags are also great for disposing of dirty diapers, keeping wet bathing suits, or cleaning out trash from the car.
feature_bullets: DISPOSABLE WASTE BAG REFILLS: Dog waste bags for dispensers are freshly scented & feature activated baking soda to eliminate odors, perfect for long walks. Fits standard dispensers. 2 times thicker than grocery bags.

WASTE REMOVAL ON-THE-GO: Dog poop bag roll is easy to bring along on walks or to the park for convenient removal of pet waste. Can also be used for dirty baby diapers, or disposing car trash. Includes 180 trash bags.

PET CLEAN UP: Swiftly clean up after your dog or cat while at home or on walks with a variety of waste management products. From waste bags, rakes, pans, trainings pads to poop scoopers, litter boxes & litter, we've got you & your pet covered.

Petmate ARM & HAMMER: Arm & Hammer provides cat litter that's tough on odor. Check out our other kitty litter products such as Clump & Seal, Multi-Cat, Unscented, Natural Cat Liter & more pet products.

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
